choices.C: The Tomcat certificate from Cluster B must be the Publisher.
choices.D: The engineer needs to exchange the CallManager certificate.

questions.question_text: An engineer has two Cisco UCM clusters and wants them using ILS with TLS Certificates. Cluster A (Pub and 1 Subscriber) will be the hub, and Cluster B (Pub and 1 Subscriber) will be the spoke. Both clusters have self-signed certificates. The engineer has exchanged Publisher A and Subscriber B Tomcat certificates, but the connection fails. What is the cause of the failure?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
To use TLS authentication between clusters, you must exchange Tomcat certificates between the publisher node of each cluster in the ILS network.

https://community.cisco.com/t5/collaboration-blogs/cucm-intercluster-lookup-service-ils-configuration-guide-based/ba-p/3358335#PassAuth

Selected Answer: C
The correct answer is: The Tomcat certificate from Cluster B must be the Publisher.

When configuring ILS with TLS Certificates, the Tomcat certificate from the Publisher cluster must be used on the Subscriber cluster. This is because the Publisher cluster is responsible for authenticating the Subscriber cluster. If the Tomcat certificate from the Subscriber cluster is used on the Publisher cluster, the connection will fail.

The other options are incorrect because:

The password is not used when configuring ILS with TLS Certificates.
Cluster IDs do not need to be unique.
The CallManager certificate is not used for ILS authentication.
To resolve the issue, the engineer needs to exchange the Tomcat certificate from Cluster A with the Tomcat certificate from Cluster B.

questions.question_text: A user requests a feature to send an active call to the mobile phone number on the physical phone. As an administrator, what should be configured in the Cisco UCM to accomplish this?

choices.D: A Remote Destination Profile having the same extension as the Mobile phone’s number adds the physical phone’s Directory Number to the RDP as a Remote Destination. Add the softkey “Mobility” to the physical phone’s softkey template.
choices.C: A Remote Destination Profile having the same extension as the Mobile phone’s number adds the physical phone’s Directory Number to the RDP as a Remote Destination. Add the softkey “Join” to the physical phone’s softkey template.
choices.B: A Remote Destination Profile having the same extension as the physical phone’s Directory Number, add the mobile phone number to the RDP as a Remote Destination. Add the softkey “Mobility” to the physical phone’s softkey template.
choices.A: A Remote Destination Profile having the same extension as the physical phone’s Directory Number, add the mobile phone number to the RDP as a Remote Destination. Add the softkey “Join” to the physical phone’s softkey template.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
This one is going to be B

Selected Answer: B
Under Remote Destination Configuration screenshot, it reads:
“If this is a mobile phone, transfer active calls to this phone when the mobility button on your Cisco IP Phone is pressed”.

questions.question_text: ABC company has decided to implement hunt groups to help distribute calls between members. In order to implement this, the administrator must configure hunt list, hunt groups, and line groups on Cisco UCM. Which distribution algorithms should the administrator implement?

discussion.content: The word should needs to changed to could.

Selected Answer: B
Our options are Top Down (Default), Circular, Longest Idle Time, and Broadcast. So answer is B.

Selected Answer: B
B is correct

Selected Answer: B
You must configure a unique cluster ID for each cluster in the ILS network. You must also ensure that you have a unique peer ID. The clusters use this unique cluster ID and peer ID when they exchange status messages. 

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/admin/11_5_1_SU7/cucm_b_system-configuration-1151su7-1151su8/cucm_b_system-configuration-guide-1151su1_chapter_011001.html#CUCM_TK_C9DDE35C_00

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. ILS has been configured between two hubs this configuration. The hubs appear to register successfully, but ILS is not functioning as expected. Which configuration step is missing?

choices.A: Use TLS Certificates must be selected.
choices.B: The Cluster IDs have not been set to unique values.
choices.C: A password has never been set for ILS.
choices.D: Trust certificates for ILS have not been installed on the clusters.

questions.question_text: Cisco UCM has 100,000 entries in the database learned through the ILS Service. Parameter ILS Max Number of Learned Objects in Database value is set to 100,000. What will happen to learned data when the service parameter value is reduced to 50,000?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Same as John

Selected Answer: B
This service parameter determines the maximum number of entries that Unified Communications Manager can write to the database for data that is learned through ILS. The default value of the service parameter is 100,000 while the maximum value of the service parameter is 1,000,00

If you reduce the service parameter to a value that is lower than the current number of ILS-learned entries that are saved in the database, Unified Communications Manager does not write additional ILS learned objects to the database. However, the existing database entries remain.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/admin/12_0_1/systemConfig/cucm_b_system-configuration-guide-1201/cucm_b_system-configuration-guide-1201_chapter_011010.html

choices.A: Cisco UCM does not write additional ILS learned objects to the database and will delete the last 50,000 entries learned to keep it to the service parameter value.
choices.C: Cisco UCM will overwrite an entry for newly learned data and keep the parameter value at 100,000.
choices.B: Cisco UCM does not write additional ILS learned objects to the database and keeps the existing database entries.
choices.D: Cisco UCM does not write additional ILS learned objects to the database and will delete the first 50,000 entries learned to keep it to the service parameter value.
